content: hey crafters I'm excited to have you with me today what I'm going to show you
is the continuation of AJ script that he won the he won our DM scrap contest and
I'm constructing that crib for him made a lot of progress on it I'll put all the
walls on got the coloring on so I'm going to show the basic layout today and
then we will move on from this video into doing some specific things for the
Crypt itself so but the Crypt looks great it's really looking fantastic so I
can't wait for you to see it so let's go to the table I'll show you now here we
go here's a crypt layout and you can see how it's progressing there quite nicely
I haven't added all the final details yet but I've got all the walls on I've
got the paint on the tiles and I've got some initial painting done so what you
can see here is I've got a it's a sandstone cave that leads into the main
complex now I'm going to have some rubble kind of transition between the
two is that'll be a nice little effect you'll notice the tiles are a dark color
AJ when he was describing the crypt I was talking that the the slabs were
basalt slabs I wanted to have a darkish color so what I did was I made the tiles
like I normally do then I painted them based on black and then I use this paint
that I have that has white it's it's a black texture paint with some white
flecks in it and that look worked it really nice and then I on the walls I
used a great blue color to kind of give the highlights on the walls
now I didn't do the shadows on these tiles because the tiles are essentially
black and you really won't see it much anyway so I just left those off but but
as you can see another detail that really pops are these runes and strange
writing now AJ was talking about this during his description I thought it'd be
really cool to have some kind of glowing writing that can freak the players out
as they come in they don't know what this stuff is it might be afraid to walk
over it or get near it so it could be cool a song that could be
not having facts in some could so I can really freak out the players as far as
that goes and this the stunt this dungeon really
illustrates something that I really like about the 2.5 D method is that this is
not your standard looking dungeon I mean these are not generic tiles these are
all specific tiles painted a specific way to give a feeling and an atmosphere
to this dungeon it doesn't just look like a standard stone slab dungeon with
square rooms and halls it has some interesting shape rooms and you know
this hallway with the with with the circular inner there's going to be a
well here but you know that's what's so great about this you can crank these
things out totally unique dungeons quickly so that's what I love about this
2.5 B method and this is a very memorable dungeon I mean it looks it
looks fantastic and it's you totally unique it doesn't look like any other
dungeon now think if you had some you know her start blocks dark or you had
some dwarven Forge and you were trying to make these shape rooms or this how
young but how murder that would be to try to make us crazy room like that you
know I just whip this out in minutes you know I'm saying it's just like this
method is so awesome for doing this type of stuff so anyways that's my rant and
here's a little adventure so you can kind of see the scale of the dungeon now
these two these two here are the secret halls and you know when when the players
come in you know this this stuff will all be gone or if they can see into
these rooms you know he won't place these until you can actually see the
secret Hall so if they find without the adventurer finds a secret hall here then
he can and you know they can move through the
secret corridor okay same with this room alright now I'm gonna do different doors
for this room I'm gonna I'm gonna do a different door for every room in this
dungeon which is gonna be freakin sweet and the doors could be challenges in
themselves to get past so that's going to be really cool for this dungeon now
this is the first level so the characters can come up these spiral
stairs here and then go to the next level I'll show that I'll show you that
now so here's our second level and these are the stairways coming up into this
level and you see I've got some cool runic designs also in that strange green
paint these will be those these are some rooms flanking the hall although they
have different doors there's going to be a strange slime pool in this room which
I haven't added yet there'll be some cool doors here to the scent to the last
chamber and as you can see I made a neat kind of runic inscription on that final
room so I just hand-painted all that so there we go that's what we got so far I
think it's really looking really great looks like a old basalt tomb with some
creepy writing some creepy runes on it glowing runes just really looks
fantastic so the next video I'm going to start detailing some of the features I'm
adding to this dungeon like the unique doors and other features that I'm going
to add to it so great we'll see you next time
for the continuation of the creation of AJ's crypt and I'll see you next time
hey crafters I hope you've enjoyed this episode of the DMS craft make sure to
subscribe and I have tons of other videos as you can see I am the
